) This section serves as a guide for performing tasks involved in processing incoming and outgoing taxpayer correspondence. (

) Purpose: To provide guidance for addressing/resolving taxpayer correspon- dence, telephone inquiries and Taxpayer Assistance Centers (Walk-In Sites) issues relating to Business Master File (BMF), Individual Master File (IMF) Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TEGE). (
) Audience: All Operating Divisions and Functions who initiate or resolve taxpayer correspondence. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Accounts Management. (
) Program Owner: Process and Program Management (PPM) Business ments. (

) Primary Stakeholders: Wage and Investment (W&I), Small Business Self Employed (SBSE), Large Business and International (LB&I), Submission cessing (SP) and Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TEGE). (
) Program Goals: Program goals for Accounts Management Correspondence Program are included in the Accounts Management Program Letter as well IRM
, Accounts Management Guide for Managers. (

) These authorities take many forms: Treasury Regulations, the Internal Revenue Code (IRC), legislation, revenue rulings and revenue procedures, advice from Counsel to name only some.

The Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) lists rights that already existed in the tax code, putting them in simple language and grouping them into 10 rights. Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in accord with taxpayer rights. See IRC 7803(a)(3), Execution of Duties in Accord with Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, see https://www. irs.gov/Taxpayer-Bill-of-Rights, for more information.

All correspondence received in response to IRS solicitations for information necessary to secure or complete the processing of a tax return. This exclusion may include responses to solicitations as the result of internal transcripts or the solicitation was solely to secure or complete the processing of a tax return in order to resolve the transcript issue. (C-NOTES). (

Several Wage and Investment Submission Processing (SP) sites will cease operations, or ‚ÄúRampdown‚Äù. Submission Processing (SP) support functions of that SP site will be transferred to another SP support site. Some of the mail activities will be absorbed by Accounts Management (AM) at that SP site. Still other activities will be transferred to another SP site (returns processing).

When instructions direct that something be referred or routed to any function normally located at an SP Site, it is the responsibility of the person making the referral to determine the correct SP location. Use the table below to route returns to the appropriate Submission Processing campus.
